_comments: 1) Parse Solidity source code and build intermediate representation (IR/CFG)
2) Run built-in/plugin detectors to scan for known risk patterns
3) Generate reports based on severity levels and filters (printers)
This configuration file is used to control scan scope, filter paths/rules, output types, etc.
Note: JSON does not support native comments, here we use _comments and *_comment fields for documentation, Slither will ignore unknown keys
filter_paths__comment: Files/directories to ignore (skip if path contains), used to avoid scanning compilation artifacts, dependencies, and scripts.
exclude_dependencies__comment: When true, do not scan contracts within dependencies (e.g., node_modules).
exclude_optimization__comment: When true, can ignore findings related only to compilation optimization (generally keep false).
exclude_informational__comment: Whether to ignore informational level (info only) findings.
exclude_low__comment: Whether to ignore low severity findings.
exclude_medium__comment: Whether to ignore medium severity findings.
exclude_high__comment: Whether to ignore high severity findings (not recommended).
detectors_to_exclude__comment: List of explicitly disabled detectors: filter noise or irrelevant rules based on project context.
printers__comment: List of output printers: human-summary for human-readable summary; txt for plain text report. Can add json, etc. as needed.
